title: Digital Health Literacy Competency Enhancement Course for Online Health Information

context.prior_knowledge: Basic internet search skills and experience using digital devices
context.additional_context: Targeting learners in managerial/leadership roles, the goal is to enhance health information evaluation and application skills in workplace settings. Conducted in a BYOD environment with project-based assessments to measure learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can classify online health information with over 80% accuracy by applying five core criteria for evaluating credibility: source, evidence, recency, objectivity, and expert verification.

Learners revise their health information analysis reports three or more times based on peer feedback in a digital literacy discussion forum and include an implementation plan upon submitting the final project.
Learners must submit and meet evaluation criteria for two health information-based decision-making case studies in a real work environment within four weeks after completing the training.

resources: Access to reliable health information database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
